Detailed Description

Obsolete - the class Menu, which uses the TextMenuAccessor, has been replaced by the classes ItemMenu and ItemTree.

Accessor which iterates over a variable number of text-strings. The text-strings are described by an instance of the class MenuTextIterator. The message MenuTriggeredMsg() is sent to the dispatcher (e. g. a Window) specified by the constructor or Init

The following example shows how to embed a Menu using a TextMenuAccessor into a Window. A note to the implementation: for triggering the menu a confirm-action assigned to the left softkey has been used. For an application-framework like BasicMMI it is recommended to derive a sub-class from Window, which already provides a menu and softkeys and hence just a menu-accessor must be assigned to the sub-class.

include <Gui/MenuTextPtrArrayIterator.hpp>
class MyWindow : public Window {
	typedef MmiMenuWindow Base;
	public:
		void Init();
	protected:
		virtual BOOLEAN OnMessage(const Message& msg);
		virtual BOOLEAN OnConfirm();
	private:
		TextMenuAccessor m_accessor;
		MenuTextPtrArrayIterator m_iterator;
		Menu m_menu;
		SoftkeyBar m_softkey_bar;
		ConfirmAction m_confirm_action;
};


include "MyWindow.hpp"
void MyWindow::Init()
{
	Base::Init();
	SetTitle(Tr(L"Menu-Window"));
	// initialize softkey-bar
	m_confirm_action.Init(this, Tr(L"Select"));
	m_softkey_bar.Init(this);
	m_softkey_bar.Set(0, &m_confirm_action);
	// initialize menu
	static const WCHAR* text[] = { L"Item 1", L"Item 2", L"Item 3"};
	m_iterator.Init(3, text);
	m_accessor.Init(this, &m_iterator);
	m_menu.Init(this, &m_accessor);
}
BOOLEAN MyWindow::OnMessage(const Message& msg)
{
	BOOLEAN dispatched = TRUE;
	if (msg.Id() == MenuTriggeredMsg::ID) {
		MenuTriggeredMsg* menu_triggered_msg;
		CastMsg(menu_triggered_msg, &msg);
		switch (menu_triggered_msg->GetIndex()) {
			case 0:	// item 1 has been pressed
						break;
			case 1:	// item 2 has been pressed
						break;
			case 2:	// item 3 has been pressed
						break;
		}
	}
	else
		dispatched = Base::OnMessage(msg);
	return dispatched;
}
BOOLEAN MyWindow::OnConfirm()
{
	// trigger menu, when pressing the left softkey
	m_menu.Trigger();
	return Base::OnConfirm();
}

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

TextMenuAccessor::TextMenuAccessor (   ) 
 

If the default constructor is used, the parameters have to be provided by using the method Init.

TextMenuAccessor::TextMenuAccessor (  Dispatcher *  dispatcher,
const MenuTextIterator *  iterator
) 
 

Parameters:
dispatcher Pointer to the dispatcher, which should get the message MenuTriggeredMsg, when a menu-item is triggered. The message MenuBackMsg is send to the dispatcher, when TextMenuAccessor::Back is invoked.
iterator Pointer to the iterator, which is able to iterate over a variable number of text-strings.

TextMenuAccessor::~TextMenuAccessor (   )  [virtual]
 

TextMenuAccessor::TextMenuAccessor (  const MenuTextIterator *  iterator  ) 
 

Obsolete - provided for backward-compatibility for APOXI-versions < 1_6. Use the constructor having a Dispatcher as input-parameter instead. This allows to specify, which Dispatcher (e. g. a Window) should be informed when triggering an item. When no Dispatcher is specified, the messages are send to the parent-window of the Menu containing the TextMenuAccessor.
